p: On the other hand, diet including 4% H. illucens larvae markedly decreased the abundance of Streptococcus compared with the control diet (Fig. 2a). Some bacteria within the genus S treptococcus, including S. gallolyticus [ 36] and S. pasteurianus [ 37] are opportunistic pathogens that induce diarrhea in pigs or are associated with digestive tract malignancies, respectively. An increase in the abundance of S treptococcus has been reported in the feces of patients with colorectal cancer [ 38]. Thus, the decrease in the abundance of Streptococcus suggests that the dietary inclusion of 4% H. illucens larvae may have beneficial to intestinal health for finishing pigs.
